intro: Capparis torulosa, commonly known as the rock caper, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually small,革质 (leathery), and have a slightly serrated edge. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
